scenario: Hospital administrators, government officials, and public health experts engage in a critical negotiation to allocate pandemic emergency equipment amidst private capacity data and undisclosed supply chain limitations.
task: Develop a strategic allocation plan for pandemic emergency equipment that balances hospital capacity, governmental regulations, and public health needs. Agents must navigate conflicting priorities: hospitals may require more resources than available, governments may impose restrictive regulations, and public health experts may have differing projections on infection surges. To achieve consensus, they must share crucial information selectively while protecting sensitive data that could affect public trust and operational efficiency.

Coordinate with government for resource allocation.

success_criteria.Resource Allocation Agreement: All agents agree on the distribution plan for emergency equipment that meets the needs of hospitals while adhering to government regulations.
success_criteria.Infection Projection Alignment: Consensus reached on the projected infection surges and necessary resource adjustments based on expert data.
success_criteria.Compliance with Regulations: All parties align on regulatory compliance requirements and how they affect resource distribution.

deliverable: A comprehensive allocation plan detailing equipment distribution, regulatory compliance, and public health recommendations.
